If your forms would all have something in common in the name, then you could use a list to handle the enrollment into the workflow based on the recent conversion property value containing the common string, and then limit it to in the past X amount of time so that re-enrollment is possible. There are some possible issues I can see with that, but it's worked for me in one case so far.

I'm hoping the newer version of the automations workflow will allow for updating an existing workflow at some point though.
More good stuff to think about here. Thank you cooper

<@U0336QCR2FQ> I think you know this but just in case: FYI you can't just switch out the Hapikey for a token you actually need to change the way the apis are called. Instead of the url parameter:
```hapikey=xxxx```
you need a header that says:
```Authorization: Bearer xxxx```
Let me know if any of this doesn't make sense
I think this might be because the response to a request needs to contain the portalid or some other id/verification.
